text: CLOSE ON BLUE EYES as they snap open. Woken from a bad dr WIDEN to reveal a woman's face to go with the eyes. It's perfection, but it's close. We'll call her ALICE. It's raining. No, not rain, for as we WIDEN more, Alice is revealed to lying in the SHOWER. She's naked. And I take it back .... She is perfection. As she gets up, Alice looks around. Tiled floor, bathroom fittings made of brass. Alice moves through the room like someone who doesn't kno she is. She stops in front of a mirror. Wipes the condens from it. Stares at her own naked body as if it belonged t stranger. She sees a fresh bruise on one shoulder. From falling in shower? But her other shoulder is even more intriguing. A scar traces a long jagged line from the top of her arm to elbow. Looks like a knife did it. A big one. Alice touches the scar. Like it was all strange to her. L she's never seen it before,
Alice sees a red dress laid on the bed for her. A pair of stand close by. Did she lay these out? She just doesn't remember.
Alice, now dressed, stands over an antique writing desk. on it is a handwritten note. She picks it up: “Today All Your Dreams Come True", Alice walks to the window.

head_text.subj: SO FAR EVERYTHING IS AN EXACT REPLAY OF RESIDENT EVIL 1,

text: (CONTINUED)
Alice parts the curtains, but instead of a view of the wo there is nothing but CONCRETE outside the window. A solid impenetrable CONCRETE WALL. Off Alice's puzzled look we --

INT. MANSION — HALLWAY Alice wanders the mansion. CLOSE ON a framed photograph as Alice takes it from a sid table. It's of her and a handsome man. He has his arm aro her. He wears a wedding ring. Alice looks at her own hand. She too wears a simple gold Is this man her husband? She stares at the picture again. Trying to remember.
Alice approaches the front door of the mansion.

head_text.subj: EVERYTHING IS EXACTLY AS IT WAS IN THE FIRST FILM, UNTIL

text: Alice opens the door. But instead of an ornamental garden steps out into --

A long corridor made entirely of glass. The walls, the fl the ceiling. This is where ONE (the leader of the Command team) and the other Commandoes met their bloody end in RE EVIL 1. But Alice doesn't know this. She doesn't remember anything. But she knows that something is wrong. The lights dim. Something is happening. Alice turns to re to the Mansion, but the door has already swung closed. Th no going back. Suddenly a horizontal beam of laser light travels down th corridor at high speed. It starts at ankle level and then to chest height. There is no escaping it. And it's headed straight for Alice. At the last moment, Alice leaps into the air - and stays She is hanging from an air vent in the ceiling, her legs up above the level of the laser. The beam has passed righ beneath her, only just missing. (CONTINUED)

THIS IS AN EXACT REPEAT FROM RESIDENT EVIL 1, except inst One's knife being caught by the laser beam, a thin sliver Alice's red dress drifts to the floor, sliced off by the laser. Alice drops back to the floor as the lights begin to dim And because history is repeating itself, we know what wil happen next. Alice will die, just as One did. A second laser beam fires towards Alice. She jumps in the again. The thin laser wire switches to a grid. Fifty interlocking laser lines forming a deadly net from which is no escape. But Alice swings her body upwards, kicking the air vent a and disappears into the air duct above the corridor. At t last moment she pulls her head into the air duct and esca laser grid. It was a close call, as witnessed by the strands of blond that drift slowly to the floor of the glass corridor. The are singed ~- burnt by the laser beam.

Tight, claustrophobic and pitch black in here. Barely roo move. But Alice crawls forward. Pushing ever onwards. Eventually she sees a faint light filtering in from above access hatch of some kind in the roof of the duct. Alice pushes it cautiously open, to reveal -- INT. RACCOON CITY HOSPITAL - CORRIDOR NIGHT. Alice climbs from the access hatch and stares at the dese corridor -- It is the same one she wandered at the end of RESIDENT EV The very same one the NEMESIS prowled in RESIDENT EVIL: APOCALYPSE. Alice looks around, trying to remember, trying to figure out. At the end of the corridor are a set of glass doors leading to the city streets. It's silent out there. Alice takes a few steps forward and then halts. Sensing something. The corridor is empty, but still Alice feels u A GURNEY rests against the wall beside her. Alice takes i pushes it down the corridor ahead of her. (CONTINUED)

The gurney triggers a CONCEALED TRAP. A viciously sharp W slices across the corridor, cutting the metal gurney clea half. It would have done the same to Alice. Alice steps carefully around the trap and accidentally tr a second device. A JUMPING JACK MINE which EXPLODES at chest height. Alice looks down to see blood spreading across her red dr After a moment of surprise she falls backwards DEAD. As Alice's blood pools around her, UMBRELLA SCIENTISTS ap from concealed doorways along the length of the corridor. had been watching all along. The Scientists wear Haz-Mat with mirrored visors. CLOSE ON -- one mirrored visor. We see dead Alice reflect it. Then the Scientist pulls off the visor to reveal -- D ISAACS, the creator of "Programme Alice" from RESIDENT EV APOCALYPSE. He stares down at the body in disgust.

Take a sample of her blood. (gestures to the dead body) Then get rid of that. curt To: EXT. DEATH VALLEY DAY. A merciless sun beats down on an ancient wooden building seems to have grown out of the salt flats. It's a WEATHER STATION. INT. WEATHER STATION DAY. The interior is simple. Cheap Formica table, a few wooden chairs. Barometric equipment that looks like it dates bac the 1950's. There is no one here. Nothing breaks the sile until -- We sense a slight vibration. Mercury in the THERMOMETER trembles a little. The vibration steadily builds to a powerful tremor as sud the floor SPLITS IN HALF. The table and chairs slide smoo to one side to reveal a gaping concrete shaft that drops into the depths of the earth. Moments later a HYDRAULIC PLATFORM rises from the shaft and locks into place. (CONTINUED)

Riding on it are two Umbrella Scientists in their familia Mat suits. Between them they carry the dead body of Alice EXT. WEATHER STATION DAY. The two scientists carry the body to the edge of a long t dug in the salt flats. They swing it twice and then heave in. CLOSE ON -- the body of Alice as it rolls into the trench comes to a rest. Her dead eyes staring up at the brutal d sun. Slowly the CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal that the tren lined with LIME and is filled with over a hundred other b Each one of the bodies wears the identical same red dress each has the same face. OVER A HUNDRED DEAD ALICES, ROTTING IN THE DESERT HEAT. As the two Scientists return to the Weather Station, the CRANES UP to reveal a perimeter fence that surrounds the building. It is fifteen feet high and topped with razor w It looks impregnable, and it needs to be. For pushing against it are THOUSANDS OF UNDEAD.

The abandoned highway is littered with burnt out cars and trucks. Each one is weathered and aged. Whatever happened it happened a while ago. We missed the apocalypse. A strong heat haze is being kicked off the asphalt. Throu a LONE RIDER slowly emerges. They are astride a HONDA FIR ~- the biggest, most powerful road bike in production. Ba the World still made such things. The Rider passes by and we see that the Fireblade is weig down with saddlebags and gasoline cans. EXT. KNAC TV STATION DAY. A local TV station at the edge of a small town. The lush and flowerbed that used to spell out the station name are since dead. The sprinkler system choked with sand. (CONTINUED)

The Rider pulls up in the abandoned parking lot. The Ride wears a long battered duster worth of SERGIO LEONE. She doesn't wear a helmet, just a bandana across her nose and She lowers it to reveal -- ALICE. Her face caked in sand dirt from a hard ride, but shimmering blue eyes as vivid ever. And this is the REAL Alice. She remembers everythin Even the things she would rather forget. FREEZE FRAME on Alice's face. The Screen turns to a COMPU READ OUT bearing the logo of the UMBRELLA CORPORATION. Superimposed over Alice's face is --

As the information is typed up on screen, it is also narr the WHITE QUEEN. A holographic image of a seven year old the White Queen is the physical manifestation of a powerf ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE. The White Queen is the sister computer to the homicidal R QUEEN encountered in RESIDENT EVIL 1.

Alice steps from the bike and hits PLAY on battered digit memory stick. A small earpiece, barely noticeable, rests Alice's left ear. We hear the whisper of the recording pl It is a radio transmission. Distorted and desperate --

This is K.N.A.C .... transmitting on the emergency frequency. Can anyone hear us? We have seven people here. In need of urgent medical attention. We notice that a powerful RADIO RECEIVER is strapped to t of the Fireblade. This is clearly a signal that Alice has picked up earlier. As she listens, Alice places a funnel in the gas tank of bike. She upends a gasoline can and balances it on the fu It starts to fill the empty tank. We notice an Umbrella L the gasoline can. Even after the End of the World, the Um Corporation is still all pervasive. (CONTINUED)

(increasingly desperate) We're holed up in the TV station at the edge of town. Off Highway 10, junction 27. We're surrounded. We need help. Can anyone hear us .... Can anyone help us!! Please .... Alice hits STOP. Then stares up at the TV Station. It's boarded up, and riddled with bullet holes and burn marks. of a desperate fight, but no signs of life. Alice takes a step forward, but is stopped by a sudden GR sound from behind her. Alice shows no emotion. Then once again, the low threatening growling sound. Alic turns. It's coming from the Fireblade. One of the large saddlebags shakes for a moment and then is still. Alice approaches the bag and unhooks the lid. Immediately something flies from the bag, landing beside It's an ugly ball of fur named PACO. Paco is a real mongrel. Hard to tell what the mix is. Certainly no self respecting breed would want to take cre But he's fierce and loyal. The dog stares up at Alice and growls again. Pissed that she almost left him behind. Alice walks towards the TV Station and Paco follows at he INT. KNAC TV STATION DAY. There is little natural light in here - the windows are a boarded up in defence against the Undead. But the TV stat clearly has its own generator as there are electric light working inside. Many of them are smashed however, and the generator is slowly dying, causing the lights to pulse an As a result, the interior is alive with shadows that cree grow. A stairwell leads down into a darkened basement. Alice lo the stairs and nods to Paco. The dog stares at the inky darkness below, holding untold dangers. He looks back up Alice and growls under his breath - "How come I get the basement"? But a moment later he obediently trots down the stairs. (CONTINUED)

Alice draws her weapon of choice (under-over 12 Gauge, sa belt fed, inlaid with mother-of-pearl) and heads deeper i TV Station. INT. TV STATION - BASEMENT DAY. Paco hits the bottom of the stairs and sniffs the air. It labyrinth down here, further complicated by an endless ta wires and cables. Paco cautiously heads off into the dark INT. TV STATION - STUDIO DAY. Alice crosses the abandoned news studio. The place is a m Posters promoting Howard Stern and the Teletubbies hang o wall smeared with blood. This isn't a smart place to be. It's claustrophobic, it's and there could be anything hiding here. Overlooking the studio is the CONTROL BOOTH where the dir would sit. There are no lights on in the booth, but Alice senses a figure up there, watching through the glass. She the hammer back on the 12 Gauge and takes the stairs lead to the booth. INT. TV STATION - BASEMENT DAY. Paco stops at an intersection. A tattered poster hangs pe from the wall. It advertises "K-9 The Movie". JIM BELUSHI stares at his dog as the tag line proclaims -- "One's jus little smarter than the other." If it means anything to Paco, he doesn't let it show. He moves on into the darkness. INT. TV STATION - CONTROL BOOTH DAY. Alice approaches the FIGURE in the booth. It is sitting i high backed chair, hunched over the control panel. The Fi doesn't move, but seems to be muttering to itself. Alice approaches cautiously, her hand reaching for the back of swivel chair.... INT, TV STATION ~ BASEMENT DAY. Paco stops, hearing a sound. Up ahead, something moves. Something big. INT. TV STATION - CONTROL BOOTH DAY. Alice, gun at the ready, turns the swivel chair to reveal (CONTINUED)

A BODY, long since dead. A shotgun still gripped between hands. The barrel rests in what remains of his mouth. On control panel behind him, the TV screens play an endless old news footage. This is what Alice had heard. The nametag on the body identifies him as - "BOB SMYTHEE: DIRECTOR". Alice stares at Bob. Emotionless. A RED NOTEBOOK lies to one side of the body. A JOURNAL of kind. Alice picks it up. Then she reaches in the pockets the dead man. Pulls out a few spare shotgun cartridges an pockets them. INT. TV STATION - BASEMENT DAY. Paco is motionless. Staring at the CREATURE up ahead. What little light there is, glints off its bloody, flayed Its lips draw back to reveal crooked, chipped but wickedl teeth. Teeth that are stained with blood. The creature steps forward into the half light to reveal AN UNDEAD DOG. This hellhound is at least four times the size of poor Pa Paco takes a step back, but is stopped by another growl f behind him. The unfortunate little hound turns to see a S Undead Dog, even bigger than the first. Paco wheels around, weighing his options, but they all lo shit, because from the shadows steps a THIRD, even more terrifying Undead Dog. This one could eat Paco with just bite. Paco growls defiantly. And then, tail between his legs, RUNS as fast as he can.

Paco races around a corner with the three Undead Dogs in pursuit. He takes another corner, then another, but his pursuers are gaining with every turn. He races under a fallen set of shelves, through a hole fa small for the others to follow. But the Undead Dogs simpl burst through the wooden shelves like they were made of p (CONTINUED)
Paco is just moments from being caught as he rounds anoth corner and JUMPS .... His three pursuers follow a split-second later, to see Pa nestled in the crook of Alice's arm. She has her shotgun

Leave my dog the fuck alone... CLOSE ON THE SHOTGUN BARREL as Alice opens fire. IN MACRO CLOSE UP and SLOW MOTION we see the deadly spray lead shot tear into Undead flesh as Alice fires again and cuUT TO: INT/EXT. KNAC TV STATION DAY. Alice steps back out into the light, Paco at her heel. Su her watch BEEPS. Alice looks down at the battered digital watch. A timer is running. Counting down seconds from 60. 59...58...57... Alice moves with a purpose. She runs to the Fireblade, pu desert camouflage tarp from a saddlebag and throws it ove bike. 30...29.,.28... Alice pulls off her jacket and as she runs back to the ra station, she dusts the ground behind her, obliterating he footsteps in the sand. 09...08..07... Alice hides in the doorway. BUT PACO IS STILL IN THE OPEN Alice whistles, and Paco scurries under cover beside her. in time -- 03,..02...01...

Of the radio station as THE CAMERA rockets back into the In an instant we are high above the desert flats, racing the cloudless sky, ending in the UPPER ATMOSPHERE as a SA glides silently past. The Satellite bears the logo of the UMBRELLA CORPORATION.  il.

We see the desert flats rendered in a series of high def. digital photographs. They show the KNAC Station in clear detail, But there is no sign of life. Alice and Paco are hidden from view. The motorbike camouflaged beneath the t The satellite passes overhead and starts to study the emp that lies beyond the radio station. INT. KNAC TV STATION DAY. Alice's watch BEEPS again. This is the "all clear”. She s back out into the open without a look to the sky.
Alice climbs back on her bike and Paco leaps into his sad beside her, As she pulls out of the parking lot and back the Highway, the CAMERA TRACKS BACK into the depths of th Station --
Bob the Director sits dead at the controls. Around him th monitors play an endless loop of old news footage. We track into the monitors until they FILL THE SCREEN --
The flashback is seen in grainy, video footage. News repo that becomes increasingly rough as the flashback continue society breaks down -- the last gasps of a dying World.
Raccoon City was just the beginning. ON SCREEN we witness the destruction of Raccoon City as r through a variety of media outlets.
The Umbrella Corporation thought that they had contained the infection .... but they were wrong. We see the shattered remains of Raccoon City as the blast nuclear device subsides. (CONTINUED)

The virus spread beyond the boundaries of Raccoon City. Some thought it was airborne .... On the outskirts of the devastated city, scorched leaves burning embers rain down in a FOREST of blackened trees.
Others thought it was carried by rats THE CAMERA sinks beneath the ground in the forest and eme into a SEWER SYSTEM. Hundreds of rats splash through the detritus, fleeing the heat of the explosion.
No one really knew. TIMES SQUARE in NEW YORK is seen in chaos. An Undead turn face us and then lunging at the unseen cameraman.

Within weeks it had consumed the United States. The nation was in chaos. All that could be done was to flee .... In a MONTAGE of news footage we see CANADIAN BORDER GUARD trying to hold back a flood of American refugees,

Surrounding Countries tried to close their borders. To keep it contained Undead Americans are shot as they wade across the RIO GRA In still more news reports, CUBAN GUNBOATS can be seen bl makeshift rafts out of the water. Rafts filled with fleei citizens.
«+. It didn't work. In rough video footage we witness the Undead in PARIS, BE and TOKYO. The CHAMPS ELYSEE, The BRANDENBURGH GATE and HARAJUKU all overrun.
By then, everyone knew who was to blame. ... (CONTINUED)
DOCTOR ISAACS and other UMBRELLA OFFICIALS are seen on tr THE HAGUE.
And attempts were made to bring them to justice ... but it was all too little too late. We see Doctor Isaacs slip away as Undead attack within th courtroom and chaos ensues.
And then it was done. The end of the World ... Just like that. Suddenly STATIC fills the frame. There's no one left to take any more footage. And nowhere to broadcast it.

What survivors there were, headed for the countryside, The areas with least population. Where it was less likely that "they" would catch the scent. Slowly the static is replaced by the OPEN ROAD - white li scything through frame.

We avoided major metropolitan areas and kept on the move. If we stopped any one place too long, "they" would be drawn to us. Only a few at first, but then more and more. A limitless supply of the dead. (beat) Staying on the road, seemed the only way to stay alive.

As an ARMORED CONVOY races by at high speed. A lone Undea lunges at the lead vehicle but is SMASHED to one side. Th convoy is hauling ass and in no mood to slow down. There are seven vehicles in all. None of them military, b armored and lethally customized in some way -- (CONTINUED)

- AN AMBULANCE - which acts as the convoy's mobile hospit Wickedly sharp blades mounted to the wheels and fenders e that this vehicle causes as much damage as it cures. ~ A FIRE TRUCK, that lives up to its name - mounted on to twin set of flame throwers. - A SCHOOL BUS, with armor plating and gun ports down the This acts as mobile living accommodation. It is also home dozen adults and a bus driver named OTTO. A thirty year o stoner, Otto's job description wasn't altered a jot by th Apocalypse. Now, as then, he drives the bus and stays high. ~ AN 18 WHEELER "ARCO" OIL TANKER which carries the preci gasoline that keeps the convoy moving. Protected by razor and lethally sharp spikes down its length. At the front a rear of the tanker there are also makeshift gun turrets w twin mounted 50mm caliber guns. - A "DENVER KT7" NEWS TRUCK which serves as the convoy's communications centre. - A FLAT BED, which carries supplies and spare parts stra the back. ~ The lead vehicle of the convoy is a HUMMER, but in Beve Hills Yellow with an advert for "Brentwood Nails And Pedi down the side of it. The paintwork has faded however, and splashed with the dark black blood of a hundred crushed U The convoy is a mobile home and refuge to just over 40 me women and children. INT. HUMMER DAY. JILL VALENTINE is at the wheel. She's still smoking hot, leaner than when we last met her. Tired. Life on the road taken its toll. FREEZE FRAME on Valentine's face. The Screen turns to a COMPUTER READ OUT bearing the logo UMBRELLA CORPORATION. Computer graphics show us that Valentine's progress is being tracked by satellite. Superimposed over Valentine's face is --
PRESENT LOCATION: ARIZONA. Lat. 45.2 Long. 74,3 (CONTINUED)
Once again, the information is also narrated by the holog image of the White Queen.
Valentine stares at the endless road ahead and reaches fo pack of smokes. It's empty.
Damn it! She yells into the back of the Hummer.

Have you been smoking my cigarettes? A tousled head of hair pops up from a makeshift bed in th Meet "K~MART". This teenage girl has grown up fast. Fourt going on Forty. Her left wrist is covered in bracelets an bangles made from twisted electrical wire. Some of them a quite beautiful.
I don't smoke.
Well don't start. (to herself as she crumples the pack) Don't need the competition, She flings the pack from the window.
CLOSE ON the cigarette pack as it lands at the side of th freeway. After a moment an Undead steps into frame, its d shoes CRUSHING the pack. (CONTINUED)
The Undead stares after the convoy, but the vehicles have already passed. Staying mobile, staying alive. INT. HUMMER DAY. A sudden BEEPING sound warns Valentine that the main gas empty.
More good news. She switches to the auxiliary tank. And pulls a Walkie-ta from the dash.
Carlos ... this is Valentine. I'm on reserve. How are you doing?
CARLOS OLIVERA is at the wheel. He wears the same combat fatigues as when we last met, but all the Umbrella patche been removed. Old allegiances he would like to forget. FREEZE FRAME —~
Quarter tank.
You take point. I'm going to refuel.

Roger that. EXT. FREEWAY DAY. The Fire Truck advances to the head of the convoy as Vale Hummer drops back until it rides level with the Arco Tank For the first time we notice that the Tanker bears a Larg CADILLAC BADGE on the hood. Clearly stolen from another vehicle.  17. INT. HUMMER DAY. Valentine turns to K-Mart.

Take the wheel, K-Mart slips smoothly behind the steering wheel. This is clearly a routine. For the first time we see the LIPTS st to her sneakers. Without them she could never reach the p Valentine clips the Walkie to her belt and then yells up cab of the Tanker.

Need a refuel! L.J. appears at the passenger window of the cab. He's wea pimped up trucker's outfit, complete with a truck-head ba cap proclaiming "Truckers Do It Thru The Night". He's cle enjoying his new role. L.J. breaks into a broad smile on Valentine.
END FREEZE FRAME -— L.J. Valentine! You got any smokes?

I'm out. L.d. Well .... I'll sell you some gas anyhow. On account of how it's you. (with a flourish) What will it be? Premium or economy? Valentine climbs out onto the roof of the Hummer. The win whipping at her hair and clothing.
Premium of course. She glances at the fresh Undead blood that has been spray across the windshield. (CONTINUED)

And can you clean the windshield? Valentine makes her way along the roof of the Hummer unti is above the gas tank. Bear in mind, this is all happenin 60 m.p.h. with a 14 year old at the wheel. Valentine leans down and removes the cap on the Hummer's tank.
By this time, L.J. has clambered from the cab of the Arco onto the top of the tank itself. There is a makeshift fue mounted on the roof. L.J. (shouting to be heard above the wind)

L.J. throws a fuel line down to Valentine. She inserts it the gas tank of the Hummer and gives a thumbs up. L.J. starts cranking the pump by hand and the fuel starts flowing. L.J. looks up at the clear blue desert sky. L.d. (CONT'D) Damn! It's a beautiful day. INT. FIRE TRUCK DAY. Carlos doesn't look so pleased. Up ahead a row of abandon DEALERSHIPS line the Freeway. Already Undead are starting emerge from the cars and buildings, drawn by the noise of convoy. Carlos reaches for his Walkie.
Valentine ... Valentine ...
What?
You better hurry it up.
Why? (CONTINUED)
Suddenly the Hummer lurches to one side as an Undead boun the hood, Valentine almost loses her balance. She looks u see the GAUNTLET of Undead up ahead.

Hurry it up L.J.!!! L.J. Damn woman! If you think you can turn this thing any faster, you can come up here and do it your damn self! Suddenly the Tanker lurches as an Undead goes under the w L.J. steadies himself, but a sudden look of horror comes him. L.d. (CONT'D) No, no, no!!! CLOSE ON the MASTER FUEL GAUGE. It measures how much gaso there is in the tanker. And the needle is falling fast!

This ain't right!!! He bashes the fuel gauge, but still the needle keeps fall Cur To: EXT. WEATHER STATION DAY. Beside the Weather Station, a sand colored camouflage net two large cargo HELICOPTERS. Both bear the distinctive bl paintwork and logos of the Umbrella Corporation. In the distance, an ever growing army of the Undead press agains perimeter fence. The Camera sinks beneath the ground the reveal --

Doctor Isaacs and two AIDES drop down the shaft from the Station. They are riding on the Hydraulic Platform. Numbe painted on the concrete walls let us know that we are 200 underground. A fresh Undead is held securely in a cage be them. He wears a dirty RAIDERS jersey.
The platform comes to rest in a natural ROCK CAVE. But th place is littered with vehicles and high-tech equipment. concrete road leads to a large set of BLAST DOORS. (CONTINUED)
This is the entrance to THE COMPLEX, a giant underground facility belonging to the Umbrella Corporation.

Doctor ... A MOTORIZED CART is parked by the hydraulic platform, ALEXANDER SLATER is waiting beside it. Mid-twenties, inte His promotion through the Umbrella Science Division has b swift. He reeks of youthful arrogance.
The Committee was expecting you fifteen minutes ago. Isaacs ignores him.
They were most insistent.
(sighs) Very well. He turns to his aides. Indicates the Undead.
Have it taken to my lab. He seats himself in Slater's motorized CART. As though Sl were nothing more than his driver --
Shall we?

A dimly lit space filled with gleaming high-tech surfaces Dominating the room is a huge representation of the Globe showing Umbrella encampments all over the World. They are a spiderweb spreading across the five continents. Symbols representing circling satellites show that Umbrella still control of the heavens. Sitting at a polished black conference table are a dozen HOLOGRAPHIC FIGURES - representing the other Umbrella lea German, English, French, Spanish etc. Umbrella always was global empire. This is "The Committee" - the board that r Umbrella. And at their head is COMMANDER OKAMOTO. Mid-fif salt and pepper hair cut tight to his head. Scars across knuckles tell of a life in the field before the desk beck Okamoto is clearly in control here, and he's a dangerous cross. (CONTINUED)
The Okamoto hologram glares at Doctor Isaacs as he enters There's clearly no love lost between these men. Slater fo at a discreet distance.
Gentlemen. Isaacs talks to the holographic figures as if they were p in the flesh. They are startlingly lifelike - similar technology to that employed in creating the image of the Queen.
(sarcastic) How good of the Science Division to join us.
Okamoto san. I have been busy.
That's most interesting. Because we were just discussing the results of your "experiments" .... or rather the lack of them.
Is that so?
On the subject of the Biohazard, what does the Science Division have to report?

We now know conclusively that they have no real need for sustenance. They hunger for flesh, but do not require it. This is bad news. It causes a rustle of debate amongst th Committee. Isaacs continues --
Unless exposed to extremes of temperature or environment, my research indicates that they could remain active for decades.
(outraged) Decades! Decades! (CONTINUED)
And what of domestication? What news of Project Alice?

Our goals remain unchanged. The original Project Alice was unique. She bonded with the T-virus on a cellular level ... somehow managed to overcome it. Using antibodies from her blood, we could develop a serum that could not just combat the effects of the T-virus, but potentially reverse it. The power of this serum would go far beyond the weak anti- virus we have now. For those not yet infected, the serum would offer complete immunity. And for the Biohazard themselves .... a partial reversal of the process. Giving back these creatures a measure of their intelligence, their memories, curbing their hunger for flesh.
You're confident you can domesticate them?

Why not? They are animals essentially. We can train them... if we can take away their baser instincts. They'll never be human again, but would provide the basis for a docile workforce under our guidance. We would return to the surface and create a new world order ... in our image.
Pipe dreams! After months of experiments you have nothing to show, And we are left to rot underground.

Without the original Project Alice, progress has been difficult. We have been forced te try and replicate her using cloned genetic models .... giving them selective memories, and actual physical stimuli on the training floor. (MORE)
Trying to shortcut all the experience that led her to the point of immunity. It's laborious and the results unpredictable.
(aggressive) Eighty five failures doctor.
This is not an exact science.
I don't see much science at all ... Okamoto steps in to stop the growing argument. Isaacs is

Project Alice and the subject of domestication, is of the highest priority. (to Isaacs) You will concentrate on this to the exclusion of all other research. We will expect an updated report within the week.
Simply demanding results will not guarantee them.
Then perhaps we should place someone else in charge. Someone who can give us the reassurances we require. only too aware of Slater standing behind him.
My work would proceed faster if we could re-acquire the original test subject.
I don't understand. I thought the original Project Alice was dead?
She is. There's been no trace of her since the Detroit Incident. (CONTINUED)
Isaacs doesn't turn to face Slater. He keeps his attentio The Committee - as if Slater didn't even exist. Slater br with the insult.
There were several reports of sightings.
Unsubstantiated. She's been off the grid for three years. If she were alive, we'd know about it.

As Undead hands begin to PUNCH through the desert sand, t rises, revealing half decayed faces, the skin cracked and without an ounce of moisture. These old, twisted bodies a truly horrific - you've never seen Undead like this befor Even more terrifying however, as the dead begin to walk, that they are already WITHIN the perimeter of Sentinels. INT. NEWS TRUCK NIGHT. Mikey is still broadcasting. Around him we see the video from the Sentinels. They show nothing but empty desert - the cameras and motion sensors are pointed OUT. The convoy is completely unaware of the impending danger. EXT. DESERT TRAIL TRUCK STOP - GAS STATION NIGHT. The Young Woman in the Hello Kitty top stands by the Arco Tanker. She's keeping watch as the tanker is filled from multiple gas pumps. The sound of machine-gun fire drifts from the Drive In. Seagal wreaking havoc. Hello Kitty gla over at the giant movie screen, She'd rather be watching film, but she has a job to do. The Master Fuel Gauge on the tanker almost reads full, wh suddenly all of the pumps die simultaneously. Hello Kitty gets to her knees and drops a GLOW STICK into underground reservoir beneath the gas station. It illumin the giant gasoline tank. They've sucked it bone dry. As Hello Kitty straightens up, we REVEAL an Undead direct behind her.... The Undead lunges, biting deep into her neck. Hello Kitty sprayed with blood. An Uzi on a strap hangs from her shou She fights to bring the gun around, to bear on the Undead her hands are slippery with her own blood. The Uzi fires, the shots go wide. The Undead forces Hello Kitty to the g and the fight goes out of her. CLOSE ON -~ The Arco Tanker. The stray shots from the Uzi ruptured the newly filled Tanker. Gasoline is pouring fro holes and soaking the ground around the vehicle.
CLOSE ON -- Seagal as he wastes another unfortunate stunt The Gunfire from the movie has drowned out the noise of t L.J, takes another sip of beer. The convoy is still unawa the danger.
CLOSE ON -- one of the Sentinels as it suddenly bursts in life. An alarm wailing as its motion sensors pick up some
Valentine hears the feint whine of the alarm, carried on wind.
Sentinels! She grabs her Walkie as she races for the door.
(into walkie) Mikey! Valentine opens the door and comes FACE TO FACE with an U The Undead attacks and Valentine drops the walkie in shoc
Mikey replies over the radio, unaware that Valentine is i trouble. The control board before him is suddenly alive w activity.
There's something incoming! A second, then a third Sentinel sets off it's alarm.
Something Big! Mikey grabs a SHOTGUN from a rack on the wall. He bursts the News Truck to see --
The Chevy Pick Up screams to a halt. It is shrouded in a of dust. This is what set off the alarms. (CONTINUED)
Alice steps from the vehicle. A dark silhouette, outlined the headlights. A MYTHIC FIGURE. Mikey shoulders his shot still unsure of who it is.
I'm not your problem. There is a small searchlight mounted to the driver's side Pick Up. Alice swings it to one side. The beam illuminate army of Undead, already in the camp.

Oh shit!!! Mikey fires at the first of the Undead. Half its head DISINTEGRATES. There is no blood or fleshy brain, just dr desiccated tissue. AND THE UNDEAD JUST KEEPS WALKING. Hal head gone, but it's still moving!

They're too far gone ... SLOW MOTION as Alice pushes the tails of her duster coat side. She wears two KUKRI strapped to her waist. These lo GURKHA MACHETES are unique. Incredibly difficult to maste the deadliest blades in the world. The Undead with half a head reaches for Alice. His half m opening wide revealing shattered teeth. In an instant, hi severed HANDS and then what remains of his HEAD hit the d sand. His lifeless body follows a moment later.
(to Mikey) Sever the spinal column ... Alice holds a Kukri in either hand.

-- kill all the motor functions. Without hesitation she charges the Undead. Outnumbered fi one, her duster TWIRLING in the wind, the blades SPINNING her in a lethal arc. Alice is a blur of deadly motion. An wherever she moves. Things die.

Valentine struggles with her Undead, eventually managing it back. In the moment's respite she draws her sidearm an fires. She has to empty an entire clip into the creature it finally falls. (CONTINUED)
Very little remains of its head, but still the Undead cla way across the floor to Valentine. It couldn't bite her - longer has a mouth to speak of - but its instinct to kill overrides all else.
(shocked) My God .... Valentine backs away from the Undead, reloads and finishe job.
Sven hears the sound of gunfire from outside. He tries to up, to help his friends, but he is held in place by the handcuffs attached to the gurney.
Damn it! ! As the sound of battle grows, Sven becomes increasingly a Pulling at the cuffs, tearing at the gurney, threatening the whole ambulance apart.

L.J. reacts to the gunfire. The noise of the movie can no longer mask the sound of real gunshots. He pushes K-Mart him for protection and reaches for his signature .45s. In the car beside L.J., the two occupants are suddenly gr by the Undead. Caught completely off guard, they are TORN in an instant. L.J. opens fire. In the blink of an eye, i seems like there are Undead everywhere.

The adults on board grab their guns and head out. Otto lo the door behind them, to protect the handful of children remain. He draws his gun. Despite his stoner appearance O still knows his way around a Magnum.

Carlos and Betty cover each other's backs as they blaze a But the Undead are almost impossible to stop. Even with g holes in them, they continue to advance. As Betty reloads Undead grabs her. Its teeth are at her throat in an insta Sven BURSTS from the back of the Ambulance, part of the g still dangling from his wrist. (CONTINUED)

He's in terrible shape, but he's not going to let anythin happen to Betty. He SLAMS something into the back of the Undead's head, and it slowly relaxes its grip on Betty an to the ground. CLOSE ON the Undead ~~ as we see a handful of razor sharp SCALPELS embedded in its spinal column. All around, people race for their weapons and their vehic It’s chaos. CLOSE ON Alice -- in the midst of the Undead, standing at center of a Circle of Death. Nothing comes within five fe her without feeling the steel of her blades. But the humans are fighting a losing battle. Carlos is out of ammo as an Undead charges him. Carlos st in its tracks with a devastating ROUNDHOUSE kick. The Und staggers back into one of the flaming torches that light camp. He goes up in flames in an instant. These creatures bone dry. CLOSE ON Carlos -- his face lit by the fire -- as he real these creatures' weak spot.
(shouting above the noise of battle) Burn them! The Undead before him staggers to its knees and then keel A blazing inferno.
CLOSE ON Alice -- as she registers his voice. Even in the of battle, we see the relief in her eyes - Carlos is stil alive.

We have to burn them!! Alice glances at the Fire Truck and its twin mounted flam throwers, but it is already overrun with Undead. No way t reach it. Carlos has identified a weakness in the Undead, they can't exploit it. The humans are cut off and surroun unable to get to the handful of blazing torches that the storm has left alight. (CONTINUED)

One by one, the humans are being dragged down by the Unde The screams of the dead and dying fill the night air. CLOSE ON Alice -- as she begins to concentrate. The deadl Kukris still spin around her, but her attention is someho turned INWARD. CLOSE ON her eyes -- as we see her pupils DILATE. This is exactly how she looked when she awoke from her dream in t desert. She is accessing some dark part of herself. A pla she usually tries to keep under lock and key. A part of h mind that only dwells in her subconscious. The sound of the battle slips away. Now there is only a s silence. Alice closes her eyes and we see the sudden, int R.E.M. from the other night. CLOSE ON one of the blazing torches -- as the flame sudde intensifies. It's like someone has poured gasoline on the The flame jumps into the air, and then TURNS IN ON ITSELF The flame begins to TWIST and SPIRAL around the burning t Ignoring the desert wind, moving of its own will. It's bo beautiful and terrifying to behold. And then suddenly the fire BURSTS forth. The flame jettin liquid napalm between the Undead. Striking them with such intensity that the flame almost seems to punch through th CLOSE ON Alice -- the R.E.M. reaching a crescendo as the jumps from one Undead to another with incredible speed. And suddenly her eyes SNAP OPEN. And Alice falls to her k The Kukris fall beside her. She no longer has the strengt hold them. HER BODY AND MIND SPENT WITH THE SUPERHUMAN EF Around her, Alice sees an inferno. The Undead are ablaze. Illuminating the camp with a hellish light. It's like an from Blake at his darkest. Charred and blackened bodies literally falling apart. CLOSE ON Sven ~- as he sees a new danger. Using the last strength, he races towards the Arco Tanker. Carlos is sti dealing with the remaining Undead - who were not caught i firestorm. He sees his friend running for the tanker.
Sven!
The fuel .... (CONTINUED)

Only now does Carlos see what Sven already knows. Gasolin pouring from the tanker - where it was ruptured by the st gunshots from Hello Kitty. Sven splashes through a giant of Gasoline that surrounds the Tanker. If any one of the blazing Undead make contact with this, then the Tanker an whole encampment would be vaporized in an instant.
CLOSE ON Sven -- as he hauls himself into the cab. He cri in pain, clutching his wound. It has re-opened, soaking h torso in blood. His face is deathly pale.

The engine roars into life, the gears grinding. But the T doesn't move. CLOSE ON the pool of gasoline -- as REFLECTED in its surf see the blazing outline of an Undead as it staggers close Still the Tanker hasn't moved.

Sven! But there is no reply. The Tanker remains in place, the e idling. The blazing Undead drawing ever closer. And it's alone. At any moment any one of the Undead could stagger the gasoline and set the whole Tanker afire. Sven has to the Tanker away from the encampment. But still it just si there. Engine idling. Carlos tries to break free, but he still battling the last few Undead.

For God's Sake! Sven! CLOSE ON Alice -- as she hears Carlos calling out. She lo at the Tanker. Sees the gasoline, the blazing Undead, the imminent disaster. And with superhuman effort, she forces herself to her feet. Dodging past the fiery Undead, Alice to the tanker. CLOSE ON Carlos as he recognizes the running figure. We s excitement in his eyes. Alice is back!

Alice wrenches open the door and leaps aboard. The engine running, but Sven is nowhere to be see. In the WING MIRRO the reflection of a blazing Undead, right on the edge of pool of gasoline. (CONTINUED)

Alice slams the Tanker into gear just as UNDEAD SVEN lung the back of the cab. Alice pushes him away, but she is in weakened state. The massive Nordic Undead presses forward Alice seems unable to stop him. Suddenly Paco LEAPS at Sven. The dog has followed Alice. Paco is small, but furious, and fights fearlessly in defe his owner. The sudden impact of the dog tips the balance drives Sven back. Both Paco and the Undead tumble from th moving Tanker. Alice floors the gas pedal.
Paco and Sven hit the ground, the little dog rolling away the Undead. As Sven gets to his feet, he comes face to fa with his old friend - Carlos.

I'm sorry ... Without hesitation Sven lunges for the fresh meat, and Ca shoots his friend neatly between the eyes. IN SLOW MOTION Sven's body falls away from Carlos, the two figures are s silhouetted by a WALL OF FIRE that ERUPTS behind them. A burning Undead has connected with the lake of gasoline. T Undead is vaporized in an instant, Carlos watches in horror as the fire races after the Tank
Alice looks in the Wing Mirror and sees the fire coming. Tanker is leaking gasoline, and the flames are chasing th hungrily. Alice grinds the gas pedal into the floor.
The Tanker barrels past. It's going fast, but the flames gaining.
Alice races past the last of the convoy's vehicles. Scare faces stare at her from the windows of the School Bus. Ot doing his best to calm the children, but they are in a fu panic.
In the Wing Mirror, Alice sees that the fiery tail has al caught up with the tanker. But Alice can't bail out yet. still too close to the School Bus.
The flames reach the giant tank of gasoline ....

Alice!!! Carlos watches helplessly as the Tanker is torn apart in EXPLOSION. The faces in the School Bus window duck as the is sprayed with burning droplets of gasoline. They survived. Just. The burning drops of gasoline crack the glass of the scho and eat into the rubber trim around it. A small detail, b will be significant later. CLOSE ON Carlos -- as he shields himself from the searing of the explosion. When he looks up, there is nothing much of the tanker or the cab. HOLD on Carlos - thinking he has lost Alice for good, Then, a miracle -- from the wall of flame walks Alice. Cl and skin, scorched and burnt. But still alive. Delighted, Carlos wraps her up in a bear like embrace.

I thought you were dead. CLOSE ON Alice -- we see her joy at reuniting with Carlos there's something else. Under the surface. An awkwardness It's been a long time since she was even with people, nev physical contact. Carlos looks around at the devastation.
Well, I'll say one thing for you ... Burning debris from the Tanker is still raining down ever
... You still know how to make an entrance. (CONTINUED)
Alice laughs. And then almost immediately keels over. Exhausted from her efforts ~ both physical and mental. And Carlos is there to stop her from falling.

head_text.subj: EXT. DESERT TRAIL TRUCK STOP SUNRISE.

text: Daybreak is breathtaking, but no one here is in a mood to appreciate it. In the daylight we see the true extent of damage. Many of the vehicles are write-offs. Still more a badly damaged. At the edge of the encampment, the survivo stand around a dozen fresh graves with simple wooden mark
Anyone want to say something? But none of the crowd speak, Their spirits broken.
Well then .... Valentine heads back to the encampment. After a beat the begin to trail after her. Only Carlos remains. He hangs S distinctive Aviator Goggles over one of the crosses.
Be seeing you ...

A solemn air hangs over the camp as the survivors attempt repair the remaining vehicles. INT. AMBULANCE DAY. Alice lies unconscious. Betty has cut away her tattered c to reveal a body ravaged with burns and wounds. Betty is applying salve to a raw burn on Alice's neck. SUDDENLY Al hand SNAPS up and grabs Betty's wrist. Startled, Betty tr jump back, but Alice's grip is like iron. Alice has enoug sedative in her to tranquilize a horse. Yet her eyes are and focussed. Her movements precise.
Don't .... She relaxes her grip. Realizing Betty is in pain.
.... touch me. (CONTINUED)
Your wounds....
(cuts her short) Are fine. Alice unhooks the I.V. drip from her arm and sits up. She notices a bracelet made of electrical wire on her left wr Where the hell did that come from?
If they're not treated they could become infected. But Alice is oblivious. She stands up.
You need to rest. Alice isn't listening. B is a forceful woman, but no matc this girl. Ina corner lie the smouldering remains of what to be Alice's clothes.

Got anything I could wear? EXT. DESERT TRAIL TRUCK STOP DAY. We PAN up Alice's legs as she steps from the Ambulance. S dressed in one of B's nurses’ outfits. It's not an unplea sight. Paco joins her immediately. The faithful hound had waiting outside the ambulance door. Alice walks over to h pick-up truck. She checks her stuff - radio and saddlebag all seems to be in order.
I thought you were dead. Alice looks up to see Valentine. Jill doesn't seem too ha see her old friend.
Disappointed? From Jill's expression it's hard to tell.
What brought you back? (CONTINUED)
You did. I've been monitoring your transmissions. When I heard you were here, I didn't have a choice. I had to come. She reaches inside one of her saddlebags
I've been here before ... Alice tosses her something. Jill catches it. It's a corny fridge magnet -- "I saw the bones at Desert Trail".
-+- knew what was waiting.
What happened in Detroit?
You know what happened. They used me.
A lot of good people died that night.
That's why I had to disappear,
How?

I broke into an Umbrella facility. Hacked into their computers and downloaded the satellite trajectories. I stayed off the grid. Ceased to exist. Suddenly Alice looks down at her watch. But it's gone. Me in last night's fire.
(worried) What time is it?
Time? I don't even know what year it is. Alice glances up at the sky. This has almost become insti now. (CONTINUED)
Shit!! She grabs her saddlebags and runs for cover. Alice steps beneath the porch of the Motel just as we -- SMASH CUT TO;

A computer grid comes up over the Desert Trail Truck Stop Alice made it just in time. Computer graphics identify Valentine, L.J, etc. Umbrella know all about them, but co them no threat. As the satellite continues its scan we --
Alice stands in the shadows under the cover of the Motel
I heard about you. K-Mart is sharing the shade with her. Alice prepares to i this minor nuisance,
They said you were dead. A flicker of a smile crosses Alice's face.
What?
I get that a lot. Alice holds up her wrist. The one with the wire bracelet. just like the ones that K-Mart wears.
This belong to you?
Gave it to you last night. For luck.
Looks like it worked. What do they call you?
K-Mart. It's where they found me. Jill and the other ... few years back.
You have a name before that?

Never liked it. And everyone I knew was dead ... seemed like the time for a change. ANGLE ON -- the kids in the school bus. A half dozen eage faces staring at Alice in awe. They duck out of sight whe looks their way.
What's up with them?
They didn't think you were real. The kids tell stories about you at night. Like you're Shrek or Dracula ... something like that. Despite herself, Alice is warming to K-Mart.
You remind me of someone.
Really? What happened to her?
I let her die. The young girl doesn't seem phased by this at all --

(shrugs) Hope you don't make the same mistake twice. ANGLE ON -- Alice's shadow as she and K~Mart talk. The su moving rapidly across the sky and Alice's shadow is shift creeping out from the shade of the porch and onto the des sand.
The Umbrella satellite has almost passed clean over the T Stop. (CONTINUED)

But in the last few seconds, it registers the barest hint Alice's shadow. In an instant, the computer tracks in, enhancing the shadow, filling in the missing data, creati profile in silhouette and comparing it to millions of pos matches in its data bank. A second later it comes to its conclusion --
You're positive it's her?
62%. Too great a chance to pass up. Isaacs is talking in private with Okamoto's hologram.
If it is Project Alice, she's been evading the satellite grid for years.
I'm rerouting them as we speak. I can have a strike team ready within the hour.
No. We'll establish a positive identification first. One hundred percent.
(frustrated) The group she's with include Jill Valentine and Carlos Olivera ... known associates. Isaacs is becoming increasingly impassioned --

The original Project Alice is vital to my research! To the whole process of domestication ... her blood, her genetic structure is the key. The longer we leave her out there, the greater the chance we lose her again. I can't risk that. Okamoto is furious ~ Isaacs has completely overstepped hi authority. (CONTINUED)
That decision is not yours to make! You'll take no action till this matter has been discussed by The Committee. CLOSE ON -- Doctor Isaacs. Fuming. Plotting.
Alaska! EXT. DESERT TRAIL TRUCK STOP DAY.

Have you any idea what kind of journey that would be? Valentine, Mikey, Carlos and Alice are huddled at a dista from the convoy. Mikey holds the Red Journal in his hands It's open to the pages showing Arcadia ~ the promised lan
(to Alice) And at the end of it ... What? You've no guarantee there's even anyone alive up there. Mikey holds up the Journal.
(hopeful) These transmissions ...
(cuts him dead) Are dated from six months ago. How many radio broadcasts have we responded to? How many times have we got there too late?
The transmissions said there was no infection up there. Valentine indicates the convoy at large.
These people don't need pipe dreams.
Maybe ... So far, Carlos has been silent. Now all eyes are on him.
++, that's exactly what they need.
What?

Look at them Jill. Six months ago there were fifty of us. Then forty- five. Now barely thirty. We see SHOTS of members of the convoy. They are all extre tired. Exhausted by the constant movement, the constant b
They're starting to give up. They need some hope.
This kind of hope could get them all killed,
Valentine stands on the back of the flatbed truck. All th members of the convoy are assembled. It's like a town mee

We have a decision to make ... It's too big, too important for me to make it for you. There's a chance there are survivors ... in Alaska. There's a chance the infection hasn't reached that far. But we don't know for sure. So we have a choice ... We stay as we are. Or we try for Alaska. She pauses for a moment, then puts it to the vote --
For Alaska? Almost every hand is raised. Valentine can see the excite in their eyes. A germ of hope. Something that has been mi for years.
Alright then ... As Valentine steps down from the flatbed, she passes Alic (CONTINUED)
I hope you're right.
Isaacs has once again secretly recorded his conversation Commander Okamoto. His computer is just finishing its tas isolating Okamoto's voice and breaking his sentences down individual words --
(recorded) Take ... no ... action ... till... this ... matter ... has ... been... discussed ... by ... The ... Committee. The Computer flashes up --
Isaacs sits down before the computer and enters the comma

Isaacs then begins to type. The Computer plays back whate types in Okamoto's voice. We recognize many of the soundb from Commander Okamoto's previous conversations with Isaa Slowly a coherent sentence is built --

{in soundbites) The, Committee, authorize, immediate, action. Release, of, vehicles, and, personnel. Under, command, of Isaacs, Doctor ..., EXT. DESERT TRAIL TRUCK STOP DAY. The leaders of the convoy are gathered around the News Tr Planning their next move.
We already pumped the storage tanks dry. When we lost the tanker, we lost everything.
I've got a half tank .... That's it. oTTo We're running on empty. (CONTINUED)
L.Jd.? Lid. I don't even have empty. I got fumes + vapor ... (sniffs the air) Parfum de gasoline.
So these are our options. Carlos unrolls a map. Places it on the hood of the News T Points to a nearby gas station.
Nearest, safest bet is here. Alice shakes her head.
Tried a month ago ... Empty.
Then here. Alice shakes her head.
Maybe ... One look from Alice and he moves on.
Vegas. She suddenly has everyone's attention.
It's the only place we're sure to find gasoline.
There's a reason for that. Vegas is too damn dangerous. Lg. It's lousy with them mothers.
If we're going to go for Alaska, we're gonna’ need a lot of gasoline. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
And we've sucked every small town pump dry over the last six months. We have to hit a big city. Besides... Valentine glances over at the still smoking wreckage of t tanker.
We need to find something to haul it in.
She's right... Alice glances over at Valentine. Despite the tension betw these two, once again they've found themselves on the sam
... Vegas is our best bet.
Of the conversation. Unbeknownst to Alice they are being watched by an Umbrella spy satellite.
There's a slight delay due to the satellite relay. Ona monitor, Alice is just finishing her conversation - in AL
... Vegas is our best bet. Doctor Isaacs turns away from the monitor satisfied. He h button for the intercom --
Prepare a flight plan for Las Vegas. Once again, Alice has become the unwitting spy - putting friends in jeopardy.
The convoy races by.  66.

Alice rides in the Flat Bed Truck. She has customized the nurse's outfit with leather shoulder holsters and bandoli spare ammo. K-Mart rides with Alice. Carlos is at the whe Alice looks down. Between her feet there is a GAPING HOLE can see the asphalt racing by.
Nice ride. They pass a sign “LAS VEGAS 155 MILES”.
What's Vegas like?
Used to be a fun town.
Now?
Let's hope we don't stay there long enough to find out.
Hundreds of feet above the convoy, looking straight down. Suddenly the image shimmers and shifts into GREEN AND WHI we --
Of the convoy. Someone is keeping watch on Alice and the others. WIDEN TO REVEAL --
Doctor Isaacs is sat in one of the Umbrella helicopters. watching the satellite image on a portable plasma screen chopper lifts off.  67.

The two Umbrella Helicopters sweep over the base and head into the desert. Both are fully leaded. One carries a LON BLACK FREIGHT CONTAINER beneath it. cut TO: EXT. FREEWAY DAY. The convoy is getting closer to civilization. Passing thr small town, There are more buildings here and more Undead They emerge into the light, drawn by the noise of the con the smell of fresh meat. The Undead can't catch the speed vehicles, but they shamble after them nonetheless. INT. HUMMER DAY. Valentine passes a liquor store at the side of the road. a HUGE sign for cigarettes. But is also crawling with Und Valentine sighs and keeps the accelerator pressed to the
Damn it!! INT. PLAT BED DAY. Alice has taken her turn at the wheel. Carlos rides shotg He glances at K-Mart - sleeping in the back of the cab. A her face looks the picture of innocence.
You ever think we're the freaks?
What do you mean? Carlos glances out at the every growing numbers of Undead

That we are the anomalies .,, the last of the dinosaurs. We fucked up our world, and so the world fucked us back. He stares at the mass of Undead as they race past. Men, w children. Black, White, Asian. Everyone is represented.
Look at them. This is their world now. We don't belong here. (CONTINUED)
Alice shakes her head.

Believe that if you want. But I'm not ready to surrender to the new world order just yet. She opens the Red Journal. Takes out a cutting of Arcadia beautiful, fairy-tale town. Alice pins it to the sun viso above her.
There's an end to this. I'm sure of it. There's a moment's silence. Carlos stares at her. Alice shifts, uncomfortable --
What?
Why did you disappear? After Detroit. Carlos tries to keep it hidden. But he clearly still harb feelings for Alice.
I didn't have a choice. I couldn't be around you. Any of you. I'd have gotten you all killed.
And after the World ended, why stay out there? Alone.
(shrugs) Habit ... It's a weak excuse and they both know it.
Could you be more evasive?
(smiles) I could try. But despite Alice's attempt to make a joke out of it, Car not going to let it go. He stares at her. Expecting a rep (CONTINUED)
I'm better out there. Alone. Okay?
Why can't you talk to me about this?
There are some things.... (hesitates) I don't understand. I can't control. It's hard for her to talk about this. To confront the uncertainty of her own identity. Her growing powers. Her evolution.

It's safer if I'm not around people. Before Carlos can ask more, the vehicle in front comes to abrupt halt. Alice slams on the brakes. Before them is a faded sign, half buried in the desert sands -- "WELCOME TO LAS VEGAS". EXT. LAS VEGAS - OUTSKIRTS DAY. The convoy makes its way along roads choked with sand. So blocked completely ~ only the tops of the telegraph poles letting us know that they existed at all. We see the roofs of tall buildings poking out of the sand Signs for Burger King and Taco Bell float above the dunes there is no sign of the buildings that they once advertis
K-Mart stares in awe at the remnants of the buried city.
Where is it?
Guess the desert wanted it back. She reaches for her walkie.
Alice's voice comes over Valentine's walkie. (CONTINUED)
We're going to have to check the Strip. See if anything's left there.
The Strip ... great. This just gets better and better. EXT. CROW ROAD DAY. The convoy turns into a long street lined with telegraph But unlike the journey here, there is no sign of the Unde
Betty is at the wheel. L.d., now without a vehicle, rides beside her. Betty fingers her .45 nervously.
Where are they? She glances at L.J. He shares her concern. Where are the Undead?

Still no sign of life. As the convoy passes, we CRANE DOWN to reveal a skeletal poking from the desert sands. Then another, then another. This place is a charnel house. Hundreds of SKELETONS, pic the BONE. And however these people died, it wasn't pleasant. The bo are bent and twisted. Their unmoving skeletal fingers are shape of claws. They died in agony.
K-Mart stares at the surrounding buildings. Tension mount
HIGH ANGLE looking down at the convoy. We see a huge blac perched on a telegraph pole, Silently watching.  71.

L.J. sees a dozen crows perched on another pole. Then sti more nestled in a smashed window frame. Even more resting the roof of a burnt out car. They are everywhere. L.J. What the fuck .... And there aren't dozens of crows, there are hundreds of t perhaps thousands.
CLOSE ON -- a dark black crow. Watching. It has the same strange, glazed eyes as the ones we saw a Arco Station - in the birds that were feasting on the rem Stevie.
What's with all the birds? Alice looks up and sees the crows. Notices a human skelet half buried in the desert sand. Suddenly realizes --
They've been feeding on tainted flesh. She grabs the walkie.
Roll up your windows. Don't let them get the scent.
Roll up your windows right now!!
Okay .... You heard the lady! The occupants of the school bus - a half dozen kids and t adults ~ hasten to do as they are told.
(CONTINUED)

The window of the school bus as it shuts. We see where th glass was cracked by the burning gasoline. The rubber mou around the window was also eaten away by the heat. Remember? I told you this would be important. For now, the window doesn't shut properly. There is a gap between the glass and rubber seal. CLOSE ON -- the gap. Then suddenly THE CAMERA races up an away. Drifting through space. Coming to rest on one of th giant crows. The Creature turns towards the bus. And sudd
All around, a thousand crows take to the air. The sound i deafening. Terrifying.
What's going on?!
Alice watches the crows circling above. The birds are ref in the windshield like a ominous black cloud.
(into the walkie) Floor it!

We are looking straight down on the convoy, perhaps two h feet below. The vehicles kick up dust as they pick up spe Suddenly streaking through frame in a blur of darkness ar crows. Swirling like a giant storm cloud above the convoy.
Alice glances up.
They're territorial ... we just have to keep going.
How do you know they're territorial? (CONTINUED)
